storyTitle: As Employee, I want to securely log in to access my schedule to protect my personal information

testCases.title: Validate successful login with valid credentials
preconditions: Employee has a valid registered account in the system
Employee knows their correct username and password
Application is accessible via HTTPS
Database is operational and contains user credentials
Browser is supported and cookies/sessions are enabled

steps.action: Open web browser and navigate to the application login page URL
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username field, password field, and login button visible

steps.action: Enter valid username in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Username is accepted and displayed in the username field

steps.action: Enter valid password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is masked and displayed as dots or asterisks in the password field

steps.action: Click the login button
steps.expectedResult: System validates credentials, creates secure session token, and redirects to employee dashboard within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify dashboard displays employee name and schedule access options
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is fully loaded showing personalized employee information and navigation menu

steps.action: Locate and click the logout button
steps.expectedResult: System terminates the session, invalidates session token, and redirects to login page with confirmation message

steps.action: Verify login page is displayed after logout
steps.expectedResult: Login page is shown with empty username and password fields, confirming successful logout

postconditions: User session is terminated
Session token is invalidated in the system
User is logged out and redirected to login page
No active session exists for the employee

testCases.title: Verify login failure with invalid credentials
preconditions: Application login page is accessible
Database is operational
HTTPS connection is established
Browser is supported and functional

steps.action: Open web browser and navigate to the application login page URL
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username field, password field, and login button visible

steps.action: Enter an invalid username (non-existent user) in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Invalid username is accepted in the input field

steps.action: Enter any password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is masked and displayed in the password field

steps.action: Click the login button
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Invalid username or password' and access is denied. User remains on login page

steps.action: Clear the fields and enter a valid username in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Valid username is accepted in the input field

steps.action: Enter an incorrect password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Incorrect password is masked and displayed in the password field

steps.action: Click the login button
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Invalid username or password' and access is denied. User remains on login page

steps.action: Verify no session token is created
steps.expectedResult: No active session exists and user cannot access protected pages

postconditions: User remains on login page
No session token is created
Access to dashboard and schedule is denied
Failed login attempt may be logged in system audit logs

testCases.title: Test session invalidation on logout
preconditions: Employee has valid credentials
Application is accessible and operational
Database is functional
HTTPS connection is established

steps.action: Navigate to login page and enter valid username and password
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted in the respective fields

steps.action: Click the login button
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful, session token is created, and employee dashboard is displayed with personalized information

steps.action: Verify access to schedule page by clicking on schedule menu option
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully showing employee's schedule data

steps.action: Click the logout button from the dashboard or navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System invalidates the session token, terminates the session, and redirects to login page

steps.action: Verify login page is displayed with empty fields
steps.expectedResult: Login page is shown confirming successful logout

steps.action: Manually navigate to the schedule page URL by entering it in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, system detects no valid session, and user is automatically redirected to login page

steps.action: Attempt to use browser back button to access dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and user is redirected to login page with message indicating session has expired

steps.action: Verify session token is no longer valid in browser cookies/storage
steps.expectedResult: Session token is removed or invalidated, confirming complete session termination

postconditions: User session is completely invalidated
Session token is removed from system and browser
User cannot access protected pages without re-authentication
User is on login page ready to authenticate again

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to have access control ensuring only I can view my schedule to maintain privacy

testCases.title: Verify access granted only to authenticated employee's schedule
preconditions: At least two employee accounts exist in the system with different user IDs
Test employee has valid credentials and an assigned schedule
Another employee account exists with a different schedule
Role-based access control is configured and active
Application and database are operational

steps.action: Navigate to login page and enter valid username and password for the test employee
steps.expectedResult: Login credentials are accepted in the respective fields

steps.action: Click the login button to authenticate
steps.expectedResult: Authentication is successful, session token is created, and employee is redirected to dashboard within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify employee identity is displayed on dashboard (name, employee ID)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows correct employee name and ID confirming successful authentication

steps.action: Navigate to schedule page or click on 'My Schedule' menu option
steps.expectedResult: System verifies employee identity and permissions, then displays the employee's own schedule data with correct dates and shifts

steps.action: Verify schedule data belongs to the authenticated employee by checking employee ID or name on schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays only the authenticated employee's shifts and personal schedule information

steps.action: Attempt to access another employee's schedule by manually modifying the URL parameter (e.g., change employeeId=123 to employeeId=456)
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt, denies access, and displays error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this schedule'

steps.action: Verify user remains on their own schedule page or is redirected to their dashboard
steps.expectedResult: User is not able to view another employee's schedule and is kept within authorized pages only

steps.action: Attempt to make API call directly to retrieve another employee's schedule using REST client or browser console
steps.expectedResult: API endpoint returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

postconditions: Employee can only access their own schedule data
Unauthorized access attempts are blocked
System maintains data privacy and access control integrity
Error messages are logged for security monitoring

testCases.title: Verify audit logging of schedule access
preconditions: Audit logging system is enabled and configured
Employee has valid credentials and assigned schedule
Database audit log table is accessible
System administrator or tester has access to view audit logs
Another employee account exists for testing unauthorized access

steps.action: Note the current timestamp before starting the test
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for later verification of log entries

steps.action: Login to the application with valid employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Authentication is successful and employee is redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to and access the employee's own schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data is displayed successfully showing employee's shifts and schedule information

steps.action: Access the system audit logs through admin panel or database query
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface or database table is accessible

steps.action: Search for log entries matching the employee's user ID and the timestamp of schedule access
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is found containing: timestamp of access, user ID of employee, action performed (schedule view), resource accessed (schedule endpoint), and success status

steps.action: Verify log entry contains all required information: timestamp, user ID, action type, and resource
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is complete with accurate timestamp (within 1 second of actual access), correct user ID, action type 'SCHEDULE_ACCESS', and schedule resource identifier

steps.action: Attempt unauthorized access by trying to view another employee's schedule (modify URL or API call)
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this schedule'

steps.action: Check audit logs for the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is created containing: timestamp of attempt, user ID of employee who attempted access, action performed (unauthorized schedule access attempt), target resource (other employee's schedule ID), and failure status with reason

steps.action: Verify unauthorized attempt log includes details of the denied access
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows accurate timestamp, correct user ID, action type 'UNAUTHORIZED_ACCESS_ATTEMPT', target employee ID, and failure reason 'INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS'

postconditions: All schedule access attempts are logged in audit system
Audit logs contain complete information for security monitoring
Both successful and failed access attempts are recorded
Logs are timestamped and associated with correct user IDs
Audit trail is maintained for compliance and security review

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to log out securely to protect my schedule information

testCases.title: Validate successful logout and session termination
preconditions: Employee is logged into the application with valid credentials
Employee has an active session with valid session token
Employee is on any schedule page within the application
Browser has session data stored (cookies, local storage, session storage)

steps.action: Locate the logout button on the current schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Logout button is visible and accessible on the page

steps.action: Click the logout button
steps.expectedResult: POST request is sent to /api/auth/logout endpoint

steps.action: Observe the system response after clicking logout
steps.expectedResult: Session token is invalidated on the server side and employee is automatically redirected to the login page within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the current page URL after logout
steps.expectedResult: Employee is on the login page with URL showing login endpoint

steps.action: Click the browser back button to attempt returning to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and employee is redirected back to the login page

steps.action: Manually enter the URL of a schedule page in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and employee is redirected to the login page with appropriate authentication required message

steps.action: Attempt to make an API call using the previous session token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized error indicating session token is invalid

postconditions: Employee session is completely terminated
Session token is invalidated and cannot be reused
Employee is on the login page
No authenticated pages are accessible without re-login

testCases.title: Verify client-side session data clearance on logout
preconditions: Employee is logged into the application with valid credentials
Employee has an active session with session data stored in browser
Browser developer tools are available for inspection
Session data exists in cookies, local storage, and/or session storage

steps.action: Open browser developer tools (F12) and navigate to Application/Storage tab
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools open and storage inspection panel is visible

steps.action: Inspect and document existing session data in Cookies section
steps.expectedResult: Session cookies are present (e.g., session token, user ID, authentication cookies)

steps.action: Inspect and document existing session data in Local Storage section
steps.expectedResult: Local storage contains session-related data (e.g., user preferences, cached data)

steps.action: Inspect and document existing session data in Session Storage section
steps.expectedResult: Session storage contains temporary session data

steps.action: Click the logout button from the application
steps.expectedResult: Logout process initiates and employee is redirected to login page

steps.action: Return to browser developer tools and inspect Cookies section
steps.expectedResult: All session-related cookies are removed or cleared from browser storage

steps.action: Inspect Local Storage section in developer tools
steps.expectedResult: All sensitive session data is cleared from local storage

steps.action: Inspect Session Storage section in developer tools
steps.expectedResult: All session storage data is completely cleared

steps.action: Verify no authentication tokens or sensitive employee data remains in any browser storage
steps.expectedResult: No residual session data, tokens, or sensitive information is found in cookies, local storage, or session storage

postconditions: All client-side session data is completely cleared
No authentication tokens remain in browser storage
No sensitive employee information is accessible in browser
Employee is on the login page requiring fresh authentication
